alert.note: Alert for Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 4:17PM EST until January 23 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 3 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory this afternoon, lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, highest across northern Porter County. For the second Winter Weather Advisory on Monday, snow and hazardous travel expected during the Monday morning commute. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Porter County. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM CST this afternoon. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 AM to 3 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow will end late this afternoon. Snow will redevelop late tonight, with the highest snowfall rates expected during the Monday morning commute. Slow travel is likely Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1- 800-261-7623.
